intro: Oplonia armata, commonly known as the armed oplonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Oplonia armata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
